channel.title: Real easy question [Cant think Atm] Geometry
channel.description:
1. Is the statement a good definition? If not, find a counterexample.
A square is a figure with two pairs of parallel sides and four right angles.
A) The Statement is a good definition. (this ones bad because its a re quiz and i got it wrong last time) B) No; a rhombus is a counterexample. C) No; a rectangle is a counterexample. D) No; a parallelogram is a counterexample.
2. Use the Law of Detachment to draw a conclusion from the two given statements. If not possible, write not possible. The doctor recommends rest if the patient has the flu. The doctor recommends rest.

item.title: Real easy question [Cant think Atm] Geometry
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“Unid H4x0r, post:9, topic:232681”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=306859.msg2454499#msg2454499 date=1222139471]

Is the statement a good definition? If not, find a counterexample.

A square is a figure with two pairs of parallel sides and four right angles.

A) The Statement is a good definition. (this ones bad because its a re quiz and i got it wrong last time)
B) No; a rhombus is a counterexample.
C) No; a rectangle is a counterexample.
D) No; a parallelogram is a counterexample.

C

[/quote]

Rhombus: is an equilateral quadrilateral. In other words, it is a four-sided polygon in which every side has the same length.

It’s B. Noob Power was right.[/quote]

IIRC a rectangle also has four right angles and parallel sides, so it satisfies the question as well.

Edit: Actually, B doesn’t even work. Rhombuses don’t always have right angles, just equilateral sides, so you’re both wrong. C remains the correct answer, because the question asked for parallel sides and four right interior angles. A slanted rhombus, although its sides remain the same length, its adjacent angles will have different measures.

Read full topic
item.source: Real easy question [Cant think Atm] Geometry

1.
Is the statement a good definition? If not, find a counterexample.

A square is a figure with two pairs of parallel sides and four right angles.

A) The Statement is a good definition. (this ones bad because its a re quiz and i got it wrong last time)
B) No; a rhombus is a counterexample.
C) No; a rectangle is a counterexample.
D) No; a parallelogram is a counterexample.
[/quote]

C[/quote]

Rhombus: is an equilateral quadrilateral. In other words, it is a four-sided polygon in which every side has the same length.
It's B. Noob Power was right.

item.title: Real easy question [Cant think Atm] Geometry
item.dc:creator: @noob_pwner noob pwner
item.description:
@noob_pwner wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:6, topic:232681”][quote author=noob pwner link=topic=306859.msg2455485#msg2455485 date=1222206355]
2 is not possible because the doctor can recommend rest for the common cold, opperation recovery, and alot of other things, also, im not a dumbass, i learned this 2 weeks ago and got an 100 on the test.
[/quote]

http://en.allexperts.com/q/Geometry-2060/law-detachment-syllogism.htm

The operative words of the problem were “use the law of detachment”.[/quote]
yes, this is true, but the question was a trick, it did the opposite of the law of detachment and therefore is not possible. you can find a counterexample for that statement as i stated before.

now if the question would have been:
2.
Use the Law of Detachment to draw a conclusion from the two given statements. If not possible, write not possible.
The doctor recommends rest if the patient has the flu.
The patient has the flu.

Then the answer would have been:
The doctor recommends rest.

Read full topic
